content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-347-07-A
|Item_parent=Acute urine retention
|Item_parent_short=Acute urine retention
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the initial assessment of urinary retention
|Description=None
|Rubric=Additional tests
|Contributors=Jonathan Olivier
|Order=7}}

* No further tests are required as a matter of urgency.
* If there is any doubt about the diagnosis, a suprapubic ultrasound may be performed to assess bladder fullness.

question.question: What is the typical outcome of a suprapubic ultrasound in a patient with acute urinary retention?

options.A: The patient may experience a feeling of a full bladder
options.B: The patient may experience a feeling of a full bladder
options.C: The patient may experience a feeling of a full bladder
options.D: The patient may experience a feeling of a full bladder
